object.name: Gertrude
object.dialog_1: Good Hamlet, cast off your black clothes
object.dialog_2: and be friendly to the king.
object.dialog_3: You can't spend the rest of your life
object.dialog_4: looking at the ground remembering your
object.dialog_5: noble father. You know it happens all
object.dialog_6: the time. What lives must die eventually.
object.dialog_8: Why does it seem so particular with you?
object.dialog_9: R:"Seems", madam? No, it is. I don't know
object.dialog_10: R:what you mean by seem. Neither my black
object.dialog_11: R:clothes, my heavy sighs, my weeping, or
object.dialog_12: R:any other diplay of grief can show how
object.dialog_13: R:how I'm really feeling. I have much more
object.dialog_14: R:grief inside me that you could ever see
object.dialog_15: R:on the outside. My black clothes are just
object.dialog_17: Let not a mother lose her prayers, Hamlet.
object.dialog_18: I pray thee, stay with us. Don't go
object.dialog_20: R:I shall obey you best I can, madam.

object.name: Claudius
object.dialog_1: Why are you still so gloomy, with
object.dialog_3: R:Not so. I am too much in the sun.
object.dialog_4: It's commendable in your nature, Hamlet,
object.dialog_5: to mourn your father like this.
object.dialog_6: But remember, your father lost his.
object.dialog_7: That father lost his, and it continues.
object.dialog_8: But mourning too long is stubborn
object.dialog_9: and unmanly. It's not the right will
object.dialog_11: It shows a vulnerable heart and an
object.dialog_13: Since we know everyone dies eventually,
object.dialog_14: why should we take it to heart?
object.dialog_15: It's a fault to heaven, a fault against
object.dialog_16: the dead, and a fault against nature.
object.dialog_17: It's irrational, since every father must die.
object.dialog_18: Please give up this useless mourning, and start
object.dialog_19: thinking of me as your new father.
object.dialog_20: Everyone knows you are the man closest
object.dialog_21: to this throne. I love you just as much
object.dialog_22: as any father loves his son.
object.dialog_23: I don't want you to go back to Wittenburg.
object.dialog_24: I'm asking you to stay here in my company
object.dialog_25: as my number one member of my court, my
